HomePage.hero: Hi! I'm Vinicius Yuji Nishioka, a Full Stack software developer specialized in Next.js for Web and Mobile experiences.
HomePage.description: Explore my projects and learn more about my work.

Projects.title: Projects
Projects.description: Here are some of the projects I actively participated in, as well as a few used for study purposes. Click on them to learn more.
Projects.half: The following projects were developed independently and are used for studying and practicing new technologies.

projects_group.title: Farol Santander
projects_group.header: Santander is one of the largest banks in Brazil, and Farol Santander is a cultural space that hosts exhibitions, events, and artistic activities. I had the opportunity to work on a large-scale project, contributing to the creation of components, adjustments, and CMS management for the website.
projects_group.description: The frontend was built with Next.js and its data was managed through a WordPress CMS. I was responsible for managing the site’s information, translations, and layout changes.

projects_group.title: Vitacon
projects_group.header: Vitacon is a real estate company where I worked on developing website components and maintaining adjustments and CMS content. I also contributed to building the document management website for their employees.
projects_group.description: After the initial development, I was responsible for handling new requests, including layout changes, content updates, and performance improvements with a focus on SEO.

projects_group.title: Cooltour Oporto
projects_group.header: Cooltour Oporto is a tourism company based in Portugal, where I worked from the beginning of the project, building responsive and reusable components. I worked closely with the designer to ensure the layout matched the client’s expectations.
projects_group.description: This project was designed to support multiple languages. I implemented a system capable of handling new languages as the website expanded.

projects_solo.title: RPG Manager
projects_solo.header: A personal project I chose to study and practice Next.js and TypeScript. RPG Manager is an app for managing RPG campaigns.
projects_solo.description: The theme was chosen to cover a wide range of libraries and functionalities, as well as to improve my knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases. I used MongoDB with JSON files for the NoSQL model and a PostgreSQL database hosted on the Neon platform.

items.summary:
Responsible for developing and maintaining modern, scalable, and high-performance web solutions, both on the frontend and backend.

On the frontend, I focus primarily on Next.js and React, with solid experience in Angular and ASP.NET Core, ensuring optimized and responsive interfaces. I use Tailwind CSS and SASS for modern and efficient styling, while also applying accessibility and performance best practices (with a focus on SEO).

On the backend, I develop applications using Node.js and ASP.NET Core Web API, integrating with REST and GraphQL APIs, and handling data in formats such as JSON and Base64. I work frequently with relational (PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and non-relational databases (MongoDB), and integrate using ORMs like Prisma and Sequelize.

I have also worked with WordPress CMS customization via PHP, created detailed technical documentation, and executed tests locally and in staging environments to ensure quality. Additionally, I contributed to version control and delivery automation using Git, and collaborated with agile teams using Scrum and Kanban, managing tasks through Jira and Trello.

About.title: About
About.description:
I am a Full Stack software developer focused on Next.js, specializing in creating web and mobile experiences. I began my studies in Computer Engineering at a federal university in Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil (UNIPAMPA), with an emphasis on languages such as Java and C#, along with more technical concepts.

With the arrival of the Covid-19 pandemic and the suspension of classes, I decided to return to São Paulo and start a degree in Systems Analysis and Development at FIAP. During the course, I had the opportunity to join Sioux, where I worked as a developer for three full years in my first job in the field.

Contact.description: Feel free to reach out and connect with me on my social media. Whether it's to discuss projects, collaborate on ideas, or just have a chat about technology, design, and the latest trends.
